abstract: International Court of Justice at The Hague rules neither Croatia nor Serbia committed genocide against each other's peoples when they were at war during breakup of Yugoslavia in early 1990s.
lead_paragraph: International Court of Justice rulings came in civil cases both countries filed after the war that followed Yugoslavia’s break-up in the early 1990s.

headline.main: Croatia and Serbia Cleared of Genocide by Hague Court
headline.print_headline: The Hague: Court Rules Out Genocide in War Between Croatia and Serbia

snippet: International Court of Justice rulings came in civil cases both countries filed after the war that followed Yugoslavia’s break-up in the early 1990s.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia
